results.name: Number A(n,k) of compositions of n where differences between neighboring parts are in {-k,...,k}; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember;
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_] := b[n, i, k] = If[n < 1 || i < 1, 0, If[n == i, 1, Sum[b[n - i, i + j, k], {j, -k, k}]]]; A[n_, k_] := If[n == 0, 1, Sum[b[n, j, k], {j, 1, n}]]; Table[Table[A[n, d - n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 15}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 27 2013, translated from Maple *)
